p: The presence of antibodies to HCV was detected in 9 (18.8%) of the 48 individuals investigated. Nucleic acid of the virus was detected in 7 (77.8%) samples of the peripheral blood and in 8 (88.9%) samples of the dental pulp ( Fig 1). Amplification of positive controls was present in all samples. One of the samples was sequenced and the phylogenetic tree showed it to belong to genotype 1 ( Fig 2).
